extendedIngredients.name: half and half
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3½ cups half and half (or use ½ milk and ½ heavy cream)
metaInformation: (or use ½ milk and ½ heavy cream)

extendedIngredients.name: pasta
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ lbs fettuccine or angel hair or vermicelli pasta

recipes.title: Mom's Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio and Unoaked Chardonnay are great choices for Fettuccine Alfredo. Creamy, cheesy, buttery alfredo dishes can pair beautifully with an unoaked chardonnay or a pinot grigio. One wine you could try is Proverb Pinot Grigio Wine. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Proverb Pinot Grigio Wine
productMatches.description: Luminous pear and apple notes animated with aromas of lime and lemon.

recipes.instructions: Salt and Pepper both sides of chicken breast.In a large skillet, heat 2 Tbsp olive oil over medium/high heat and saute chicken until golden brown and cooked through.Cut chicken into strips.Cook your noodles of choice according to the package instructions.Add 1 tsp salt to the pot with water.In a large, deep skillet, over medium/high, heat 3 Tbsp of olive oil and 1 Tbsp of butter. Add onion and saute for 1 minute, or until soft.Add garlic and saute another 30 seconds, stirring constantly.Reduce heat to medium. Add mushrooms, cover and saute 5 to 7 minutes, or until soft, stirring frequently.Add half-n-half. Over medium/high heat, simmer the sauce for 5 minutes until it is just barely beginning to thicken . It will not coat the noodles very well when it is hot, but let it cool just a little and it will get much thicker. Season to taste (1/2 tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper).Add the chicken and season with more salt and pepper to taste.Add the cooked noodles and mix everything together.

steps.step: Salt and Pepper both sides of chicken breast.In a large skillet, heat 2 Tbsp olive oil over medium/high heat and saute chicken until golden brown and cooked through.
Cut chicken into strips.Cook your noodles of choice according to the package instructions.
Add 1 tsp salt to the pot with water.In a large, deep skillet, over medium/high, heat 3 Tbsp of olive oil and 1 Tbsp of butter.
Add onion and saute for 1 minute, or until soft.
Add garlic and saute another 30 seconds, stirring constantly.Reduce heat to medium.
Add mushrooms, cover and saute 5 to 7 minutes, or until soft, stirring frequently.

Add half-n-half. Over medium/high heat, simmer the sauce for 5 minutes until it is just barely beginning to thicken . It will not coat the noodles very well when it is hot, but let it cool just a little and it will get much thicker. Season to taste (1/2 tsp salt, ¼ tsp pepper).
Add the chicken and season with more salt and pepper to taste.
Add the cooked noodles and mix everything together.
